title: American_Top_40_1987_May_9th
description:
"The biggest hits in the nation are yet to come as we count 'em down on our way to number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:
	
Casey tells of one artist in the countdown who was once given a bootleg tape and turned it into a Grammy winning album.

In the history of the chart, only one man has ever hit number one with an instrumental record and a vocal record. He is in this countdown.

A listener wants to know, "In the rock era, what man and woman have had the longest span of time between their first top ten hit and their most recent top ten hit?" Casey sats the man is a "King" and the woman is a "Knight."

Casey explains why the band Bon Jovi used a photo of a trash bag for one of thier album covers.

There is a song in the countdown by Jamie Starr, Joey Cocoa, Christopher Tracy, and Alexander Nevermind, and they're all the same person.
